FuncDef:
The ptp clock-source bits1 on command allows a device to use BITS1 clock signals to calculate the best master clock (BMC).
The ptp clock-source bits1 off command disables a device from using BITS1 clock signals to calculate the BMC.
By default, a device does not use BITS1 signals to calculate the BMC.
CLIs: ptp clock-source bits1 { on | off } [ slot <slotid> ]
ptp clock-source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] { bits0 | bits1 | bits2 } { on | off }
ptp clock-source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] bits1 { on | off } [ slot <slotid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of the main control board.
Only the master and slave main control boards that can exchange BITS signals support the configurations of the slot slot-id keyword and parameter.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies a chassis, which is represented in the form of chassis type+chassis ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 20 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow a device to use a BITS interface to synchronize the time with other devices, run the ptp clock-source bits1 on command on the device.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
